review: I bought this to convert my 50" HDTV into a 'Smart' TV. I was really excited about this device because it had all the apps that I normally use on my laptop: Netflix, Youtube, Hulu Plus, & Pandora, and I would finally be able to watch them on my TV. It does not disappoint. The set-up is a piece of cake and in under 5 minutes of plugging it in to your TV you have morphed your regular television into a "Smart" television. The apps that it originally came out with has now doubled. As of today (2/16/14) the apps the Chromecast have added include: Vevo, Red Bull TV, Songza, Plex, Viki, RealPlayer Cloud, Avia, Revision3, & BeyondPod. Google use announced that they have opened the floodgates to developers that want to add the "Chromecast button" to their applications, this means that we could soon be seeing thousands of apps be supported on Chromecast. Imagine playing Real Racing 3 from your tablet or phone onto your TV? The Chromecast is worth well over it's asking price and is IMO the steal of the century.
author: Aaron Ray

review: I expected this device to basically be a wireless hdmi input to view whatever you have on your computer screen on your TV.  It was only kinda like that.  When viewing videos other than youtube online it lags and the mouths don't match up to the sound.  Youtube works pretty flawlessly through it.  It's pretty easy to set up overall if you know how to use a computer.  If you are clueless with computers it may be difficult and you may need to watch a how-to video.  Chromecast was not what I expected, I feel like I would have been better off just getting a 20 foot long hdmi cable, but it still does a few cool things I guess.
